data.meta_description: The Mourners: Medieval Tomb Sculptures from the Court of Burgundy // Photo by Trish Mayo // During the renovation of the Mus√©e des Beaux-Arts in Dijon these alabaster mourner figures are on loan to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. The figures carved by Jean de La Huerta and Antoine Le Moiturier between 1443 and 1456 are from the tomb of John the Fearless, Duke of Burgundy, and his wife, Margaret of Bavaria.
